herosection.slogan: We are with you in the world of international trade!
herosection.text: Accompanying you throughout all stages of importing goods

services.title: Insurance Services
options: Cargo insurance at all stages of transportation

FAQ.title: How long does it take to import goods?
FAQ.reply:
The import duration varies depending on the country of origin:
- China: 8 to 10 weeks (Sea)
- Dubai: 2 to 3 weeks
- India: 3 to 4 weeks
- Air Freight: 10 to 12 days

FAQ.title: What are the shipping methods available?
FAQ.reply:
We offer multiple shipping options:
- Sea Freight: Suitable for large shipments, cost-effective but takes longer.
- Air Freight: Faster but more expensive.
- Land Transport: Available for specific routes.

FAQ.title: What documents are required for import?
FAQ.reply:
The required documents include:
- Commercial Invoice
- Packing List
- Bill of Lading (Sea) or Airway Bill (Air)
- Customs Declaration
- Any additional country-specific permits

FAQ.title: Do you provide customs clearance services?
FAQ.reply: Yes, we handle all customs clearance procedures, including tariff calculations, document preparation, and coordination with local authorities.

FAQ.title: Can I track my shipment?
FAQ.reply: Yes, we provide tracking options based on the shipping method used. You will receive tracking details once your goods are dispatched.

FAQ.title: Are there any restrictions on importing goods?
FAQ.reply: Yes, certain goods require special permits or may be restricted by Iranian customs. Please contact us for specific regulations on your products.

FAQ.title: How are import costs calculated?
FAQ.reply:
Import costs depend on factors such as:
- Freight charges
- Customs duties and taxes
- Insurance fees
- Handling and clearance costs
